018package org.opengis.metadata.spatial;
019
020import org.opengis.util.CodeList;
021import org.opengis.annotation.UML;
022import org.opengis.geoapi.internal.Vocabulary;
023
024import static org.opengis.annotation.Obligation.*;
025import static org.opengis.annotation.Specification.*;
026
027
028/**
029 * Method used to represent geographic information in the dataset.
030 *
031 * @author  Martin Desruisseaux (IRD)
032 * @version 3.1
033 * @since   2.0
034 */
035@Vocabulary(capacity=6)
036@UML(identifier="MD_SpatialRepresentationTypeCode", specification=ISO_19115)
037public final class SpatialRepresentationType extends CodeList<SpatialRepresentationType> {
038    /**
039     * Serial number for compatibility with different versions.
040     */
041    private static final long serialVersionUID = 4790487150664264363L;
042
043    /**
044     * Vector data is used to represent geographic data.
045     */
046    @UML(identifier="vector", obligation=CONDITIONAL, specification=ISO_19115)
047    public static final SpatialRepresentationType VECTOR = new SpatialRepresentationType("VECTOR");
048
049    /**
050     * Grid data is used to represent geographic data.
051     */
052    @UML(identifier="grid", obligation=CONDITIONAL, specification=ISO_19115)
053    public static final SpatialRepresentationType GRID = new SpatialRepresentationType("GRID");
054
055    /**
056     * Textual or tabular data is used to represent geographic data.
057     */
058    @UML(identifier="textTable", obligation=CONDITIONAL, specification=ISO_19115)
059    public static final SpatialRepresentationType TEXT_TABLE = new SpatialRepresentationType("TEXT_TABLE");
060
061    /**
062     * Triangulated irregular network.
063     */
064    @UML(identifier="tin", obligation=CONDITIONAL, specification=ISO_19115)
065    public static final SpatialRepresentationType TIN = new SpatialRepresentationType("TIN");
066
067    /**
068     * Three-dimensional view formed by the intersecting homologous rays of an overlapping pair of images.
069     */
070    @UML(identifier="stereoModel", obligation=CONDITIONAL, specification=ISO_19115)
071    public static final SpatialRepresentationType STEREO_MODEL = new SpatialRepresentationType("STEREO_MODEL");
072
073    /**
074     * Scene from a video recording.
075     */
076    @UML(identifier="video", obligation=CONDITIONAL, specification=ISO_19115)
077    public static final SpatialRepresentationType VIDEO = new SpatialRepresentationType("VIDEO");
078
079    /**
080     * Constructs an element of the given name.
081     *
082     * @param name  the name of the new element. This name shall not be in use by another element of this type.
083     */
084    private SpatialRepresentationType(final String name) {
085        super(name);
086    }
087
088    /**
089     * Returns the list of {@code SpatialRepresentationType}s.
090     *
091     * @return the list of codes declared in the current JVM.
092     */
093    public static SpatialRepresentationType[] values() {
094        return values(SpatialRepresentationType.class);
095    }
096
097    /**
098     * Returns the list of codes of the same kind as this code list element.
099     * Invoking this method is equivalent to invoking {@link #values()}, except that
100     * this method can be invoked on an instance of the parent {@code CodeList} class.
101     *
102     * @return all code {@linkplain #values() values} for this code list.
103     */
104    @Override
105    public SpatialRepresentationType[] family() {
106        return values();
107    }
108
109    /**
110     * Returns the spatial representation type that matches the given string, or returns a new one if none match it.
111     * This methods returns the first instance (in declaration order) for which the {@linkplain #name() name}
112     * is {@linkplain String#equalsIgnoreCase(String) equals, ignoring case}, to the given name.
113     * If no existing instance is found, then a new one is created for the given name.
114     *
115     * @param  code  the name of the code to fetch or to create.
116     * @return a code matching the given name.
117     */
118    public static SpatialRepresentationType valueOf(String code) {
119        return valueOf(SpatialRepresentationType.class, code, SpatialRepresentationType::new).get();
120    }
121}
